alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 11:56PM CDT until April 13 at 2:50AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Clark County in southwestern Arkansas... Western Dallas County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Hot Spring County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 250 AM CDT. * At 1156 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar was estimating between two and three inches of rain have fallen in the last one to two hours. Additional heavy rainfall is likely, and flash flooding is likely to occur. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arkadelphia, Malvern, Gurdon, Amity, Caddo Valley, Perla, Okolona, Whelen Springs, Beirne, Gum Springs in Clark County, Richwoods, DeGray Lake State Park, Halfway, Donaldson, Friendship, Antoine, Alpine, Lower Lake Recreation Area, Griffithtown and Curtis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
